hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Bundar: Muhammad, who is Ghundar, narrated to us, Shu'bah narrated to us. He said: I heard Abu Ishaq narrating that he heard Kudir al-Dhabbi narrating, that a man came to the Prophet ﷺ and said: Inform me of a deed that enters me into Paradise. He said: Speak justice and advance mercy. He said: I cannot do that. He said: Feed the food and spread the greeting, and pray while the people are sleeping. Shu'bah doubted about spreading the greeting, though he mentioned it. He said: I cannot do that. He said: Do you have camels? He said: Yes. He said: Look at a camel in them and a water-skin, then look at a family who do not find water except occasionally, so water them. Perhaps your water-skin will not be pierced and your camel will not diminish until Paradise becomes due for you.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Muhammad ibn Musaffi: Baqi'yyah narrated to us, from Muslim ibn Abdullah, Ziyad ibn Abdullah narrated to me, from Asim ibn Muhammad, from his father, from his grandfather (may Allah be pleased with him). He said: The Prophet ﷺ forbade us from drinking on our bellies, which is lapping (kara'), and commanded us to scoop water with the hand. He said: Let none of you lap like a dog does, and let none drink with one hand as the people upon whom Allah's wrath was sent down drink, and let none drink at night from a vessel unless he moves/stirs the vessel, unless it is covered. Whoever drinks with both his hands while he is able to use a vessel, intending thereby humility, Allah the Exalted will write for him good deeds equal to the number of his fingers, and it is the vessel of Jesus son of Mary upon him be peace, when he threw down the cup and said: This is along with the world.
